data.text:
"Thank you, Arnold @Schwarzenegger for helping me do the heavy lifting to protect our planet. We all need to work together to tackle the global climate emergency."

Watch @antonioguterres' conversation with former California Governor at @R20_AWS in Vienna: https://t.co/z3M3YDFbqc https://t.co/qu3u0yJTTu

"We are implementing change at an unprecedented pace and scale. And we are doing so because the challenges facing the world demand no less."-- @antonioguterres on UN reform. https://t.co/8eao2YUMbU https://t.co/biStdgKoBY
Parents act selflessly to protect & nurture their children, helping achieve the #GlobalGoals. More on Saturday's #ParentsDay. https://t.co/a3BLTLw0TI https://t.co/ARSX9cXU0v

All societies tend to be multi-ethnic, multi-cultural & multi-religious nowadays. This must be considered as a richness not a threat — @antonioguterres as he received the International Charlemagne Prize earlier this week https://t.co/JU3feR80o6 https://t.co/mmyqgra1Lp

.@ashanti, @MeaganGood, @machelmontano & @UNEnvironment Goodwill Ambassador @adriangrenier join @UN_PGA & more to help #BeatPlasticPollution at the #PlayItOut concert in Antigua. Watch live Saturday 1 June, 18:00 EST. https://t.co/jZCftWxu74 https://t.co/RHEWRVPWwT
How are parents key to achieving the #GlobalGoals? Find out on Saturday's #ParentsDay: https://t.co/cfjm5ZNd9w https://t.co/wkGnHoUNlX

“To live is to choose.  But to choose well, you must know who you are and what you stand for, where you want to go and why you want to get there.” 
Late Secretary-General @KofiAnnan featured on new @unstamps.  https://t.co/PIPVzRflHB https://t.co/PmaUoRdVDX
Saturday's #ParentsDay is an opportunity to celebrate parents and their selfless commitment to children: https://t.co/cfjm604Oy6 https://t.co/zW8LLoECcZ
Tobacco kills over 8 million people a year, including 1.2 million from second-hand smoke exposure. More from @who on Friday's World #NoTobacco Day: https://t.co/NBFkLW79rq https://t.co/xWfsEsUcsF

Air pollution affects us all - but women, children, the elderly & low-income groups are most vulnerable. Help #BeatAirPollution ahead of #WorldEnvironmentDay: https://t.co/JKtC03wV58 via @UNEnvironment https://t.co/6087Fc5pUI

Tobacco kills over 8M people each year, despite the steady reduction in its use globally. On Friday's #NoTobacco Day, check out these key facts from @WHO: https://t.co/9OnWpGuNQk https://t.co/enyRjmpD0E

The 2019 Global Youth Video Competition is underway! Entries from young #ClimateAction leaders will be accepted through 28 July, with a chance to win a trip to #COP25: https://t.co/rmoylblCzD https://t.co/a8DBrp1QnQ

The tobacco epidemic is one of the world's largest, yet preventable, public health threats, resulting in more than 8 million deaths a year. Friday is World #NoTobacco Day. https://t.co/NBFkLW79rq https://t.co/V6WSRstWrw

Violence against women has profound costs & consequences on individuals, communities & societies. More on @who's new RESPECT framework for preventing violence against women: https://t.co/aWLRduSUI3  #EndViolence https://t.co/6NqlyESr56
Smoking more than doubles the risk of developing tuberculosis - the world's top infectious killer. Friday is World #NoTobacco Day. https://t.co/NBFkLVPy2Q https://t.co/tnOx2XyNhA

Pledging conference underway to help 1.85 million people affected by cyclones Idai and Kenneth in Mozambique, amid fears acute food insecurity will persist through coming months. https://t.co/CO2rRYPRAs #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/a4HHoKDiQ0
New partnership with @Dataminr announced at #AIforGood Summit, allowing UN to have greater data access to support #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/mTLiK6jh7f https://t.co/2YvE0FREeE

At this time of great anxiety & geopolitical disorder we need multilateralism more than ever —@antonioguterres as he receives the International Charlemagne Prize https://t.co/JU3feR80o6 https://t.co/zhqnFydQos
More than 250,000 Rohingya refugees have been registered in Bangladesh. For many of them, this is the 1st time they have had official identification documents. https://t.co/J2J5l5dDH5 via @refugees
From reaching #ZeroHunger to ending poverty, this week's #AIForGood Global Summit explored how artificial intelligence can help achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/umVglQmxmA

“Normally I say 'I'll be back', but now I say: 'I'll be there'" -- Arnold @Schwarzenegger on invite from @antonioguterres to the UN #ClimateAction Summit in September. https://t.co/yAXgSbKnOU
https://t.co/ojln7yigNw

80% of the 🌎's food is produced on family farms. On Wednesday's launch of the Decade of #FamilyFarming, see why farms run by families are key to achieving #ZeroHunger: https://t.co/c9zI3140Mf https://t.co/k9kXmb8l4x
Urgent action needed to reduce  tobacco exposure, says @who in new report that highlights huge scale of tobacco-related deaths. https://t.co/fC4vcwtIOF

Fallen peacekeeper Private Chancy Chitete of Malawi was posthumously awarded @UNPeacekeeping's highest honour for bravery. 

Hear from the man whose life he saved on Wednesday's UN Peacekeepers Day. #PKDay https://t.co/1mBgm3eGPt

UN peacekeepers make great sacrifices & are often deployed far from their homes & families. Over 3,800 UN peacekeepers have sacrificed their lives while #ServingForPeace. More on Wednesday's UN Peacekeepers Day. https://t.co/muO4uczEAB #PKDay https://t.co/20Fq4YMZvE
Afghanistan: attacks against schools have tripled in the last year, says @unicef, with half a million children being denied their right to education. https://t.co/pkICsaGioh

New @UNHumanRights report shows cycle of human rights violations in Democratic People’s Republic of Korea due to country's failure to uphold basic standards of living. https://t.co/DrAfUC2BAN #StandUpForHumanRights

"As taxpayers, I believe we would like to see our money back, rather than to see our money used to destroy the world. -- @antonioguterres at @R20_AWS on how to take urgent #ClimateAction. https://t.co/KlzLyo7PLY https://t.co/eUo2RDZLUv

Menstruation can result in discrimination, stigma & exclusion against women & girls. #StandUp4HumanRights and get the facts from @UNFPA on Tuesday’s Menstrual Hygiene Day: https://t.co/NwT54E9KIt #MenstruationMatters https://t.co/M6JkrRKiQU

"The little things you do with a warm touch and a kind heart can make a difference" - @UNPeacekeeping's female peacekeeper of the year, on what motivates her work. https://t.co/Q8a3jGSPvH #ServingForPeace

#ClimateAction is good for the people and good for the planet. -- @antonioguterres at @R20_AWS with President @VanderBellen, Arnold @Schwarzenegger, @GretaThunberg & more.  https://t.co/W6KakEDwVB https://t.co/CC1QGf1rNT

Happy birthday, @UN_Vienna!

For 40 years, our colleagues working in Austria have made a difference in the lives of people around the world. See more #UNVienna info here: https://t.co/3NBAIFAfg6 https://t.co/Yx2kAPMiOa
From stay-at-home mom, to climate activist, read about one woman's #ClimateAction journey to save her community in Chile, with support from @undp. https://t.co/UPkK5AHNKZ

“Societies today are multi-ethnic, multi-religious, multi-cultural. And that is a richness, not a threat" – @AntonioGuterres at a special event with Messenger of Peace @YoYo_Ma https://t.co/gNESNsNpYB

Brave men & women from Cambodia are serving with @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world. They work in harsh conditions to protect some of the world's most vulnerable people. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/Btol4BnF2e

.@AntonioGuterres calls on "young people to push my generation, their parents & societies" to save our planet & our future in his first-ever live #ClimateAction conversation on @Instagram w/ @GretaThunberg. See here: https://t.co/7RIBpS4RJg https://t.co/ys3ZAYyPef
The Junior Professional Officer Programme helps bring entry-level staff members on-board for careers with the UN. Get details here: https://t.co/MnlWA1fDI4 https://t.co/VWRUeO1Y6p

“This is the world we want: a world in which contributions from everybody, everywhere matter” - @antonioguterres at music workshop #WithRefugees and @YoYo_Ma in Vienna. https://t.co/4SqrNiCOrb https://t.co/s3rHnvcqYD
Watch @antonioguterres discuss #ClimateAction with @GretaThunberg live on @instagram on Monday at 11.40 AM (ET): https://t.co/7RIBpS4RJg https://t.co/iRnN3XUXh6

Happening this week: @fao & @ifad launch the Int'l Decade of #FamilyFarming to call attention to the contributions of farmers in a rapidly changing world. https://t.co/c9zI3140Mf https://t.co/3ZbtjMG3xW
Happening this week:  1st-ever @UNHABITAT Assembly takes place in Narobi, Kenya. https://t.co/Oa71H0SsN1 #UNHabitatAssembly https://t.co/H8aJf1WPpQ

What's happening this week at the UN? 1st-ever @UNHABITAT Assembly, launch of Decade of Family Farming, Play it Out Festival to #BeatPlasticPollution and @UN_Vienna celebrates 40 years: https://t.co/gQtGrteN0f https://t.co/WXaobWwDJT
This year's #WorldOceansDay on 8 June will focus on the actions needed around the world to protect our seas: https://t.co/tyj0F4bTD6 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/M1p8DZWxhd
In the last 20 years, protecting civilians has become one of the Security Council’s main priorities. Latest UN report: https://t.co/JWbvk0kbUp via @UNOCHA https://t.co/RtGVofzeG0
Ebola: @WHO and partners working to strengthen the response and end the outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Update: https://t.co/2ZOnFz3q8X https://t.co/hVRjNyeiDX

14 million tons of plastic end up in our oceans every year. 

New @NatGeoMuseum "Planet or Plastic?"  exhibit at UNHQ highlights urgent need to #BeatPlasticPollution: https://t.co/2qnhYLtUnd https://t.co/OqmfhocXGC
Apply for the 2019 UN training for Palestinian journalists here ➡️ https://t.co/pffU2d5AV1 . Deadline is 19 June. #PalJournos https://t.co/POCDiPsvT5

Young people should be at the forefront of preventing and responding to violent extremism. A new @UNDP report calls for including them in decision-making processes. Info: https://t.co/kzHohiSZ9C https://t.co/XsavG2U43N

.@unmas is working to bring more women to the frontlines of mine clearance efforts in Iraq, despite the challenges of long-standing cultural & social norms. More: https://t.co/HtM1uXWNGL https://t.co/He7zfUmzea

📣 The search is on for 2019 SDG pioneers! The @globalcompact is seeking young professionals under 35 years old who are working to help achieve the #GlobalGoals. Apply today: https://t.co/wAGoBTmZYh https://t.co/mcdVTUsAAb

The widow of late UN peacekeeper Chancy Chitete of Malawi was presented the Captain Mbaye Diagne Medal by @antonioguterres on Friday - @unpeacekeeping's highest honour for bravery. https://t.co/p4qxotGVbU #ServingForPeace https://t.co/RqbXhpmmxb

Students in schools & universities around the world are leading by example when it comes to #ClimateAction. @UNenvironment shares some examples from Australia, Kenya, UK and the US here: https://t.co/7b1YvlTIsd
In times of disaster & conflict, sexual and gender-based violence spikes. @UN_Women brings us stories of strength and hope from survivors & advocates. https://t.co/8NG8Gv4ouS #EndSGBVOslo

Aid workers often need access to the world's most remote and challenging locations. Thanks to @WFP_UNHAS, more than 12,000 humanitarian workers were flown in and out of Yemen last year. More on the  Humanitarian Air Service's lifesaving work: https://t.co/hLL5dCjYoR https://t.co/1wiigH8IUW

Brave women & men from Cambodia leave their families behind and are #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world. We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/v9j0qEErOQ

In the Pacific, @antonioguterres called for urgent #ClimateAction. 

Here's how you can help make a difference every day: https://t.co/ByuqaEBbfe https://t.co/kSCqKrM2kQ
Violence and drought is affecting most vulnerable in Afghanistan. Urgent funding needed to help children suffering from acute malnutrition, warns @unicef. https://t.co/x8g5uwVINm

"We are working closely with the @_AfricanUnion and African Member States to combat climate change, the defining issue of our time." -- @antonioguterres marking #AfricaDay. https://t.co/Lb9A3fqeon #ClimateAction https://t.co/VlJuda7ZEp
20+ countries pledge $363M to improve responses to & prevent sexual violence in humanitarian crises. https://t.co/UflvPNATV7 #EndSGBVOslo

"States need to seek security through diplomacy & dialogue, not by building new weapons." - @antonioguterres marking one year since the launch of the disarmament agenda. https://t.co/yJhjwOCZCJ #GlobalGoals https://t.co/G77zfbUWcY

Students around the world spoke up Friday, demanding urgent #ClimateAction. Go to https://t.co/zTkumwytsA  to see how YOU can help tackle the global climate emergency & protect our planet. https://t.co/ttysYFQ7wx

"More than 1M men & women have served under the blue flag of the UN. The vast majority returned home to their countries & their loved ones. Today, we honour the memory of those who didn’t." -@antonioguterres at ceremony honouring fallen UN peacekeepers. https://t.co/3Yks8V3DhA https://t.co/NguXuzjCl5

Since the onset of conflict in Tripoli:

➡️ 9,500 displaced Libyans received humanitarian assistance
➡️ 1,400+ refugees & migrants relocated to safe zones
➡️ 300+ evacuated to Italy & Niger
Here's how else @refugees is helping: https://t.co/OmEmQh1MeK https://t.co/VdlBvYEu4J
Civil society plays a key role in helping to achieve the #GlobalGoals. Join our efforts & apply for @UNECOSOC NGO status by 1 June: https://t.co/D8ReqiMUXu https://t.co/nTjoROrSnc

A fallen peacekeeper from Malawi is being honoured with @unpeacekeeping's highest distinction for bravery. 

Private Chancy Chitete lost his life protecting fellow soldiers while #ServingForPeace in the Democratic Republic of Congo. https://t.co/79vukDyOgR https://t.co/C0XhJ4Djz8
Democratic Republic of the Congo: @WHO & @UNPeacekeeping mission announce new measures to work to end the Ebola outbreak that has claimed more than 1,200 lives https://t.co/DKfd6UJvlm

While safeguards are stronger, “compliance has deteriorated,” @antonioguterres says as Security Council looks back at 20 years of progress on protecting civilians in conflict https://t.co/BcBBmOGo8q #POC20 https://t.co/hZX36JoKt0

Good news! Algeria 🇩🇿 and Argentina 🇦🇷 have been officially declared malaria-free by @who, after stopping transmission of the disease for 3 straight years. https://t.co/lG783F3U6e #EndMalaria https://t.co/sXbwU6nOgq

On Thursday's #EndFistula Day, learn more about what @UNFPA is doing to help women recover from this preventable, devastating childbirth injury.  
https://t.co/BiBImzigrv https://t.co/PBpRfvE300

Recruiting boys and girls into the armed forces is a war crime. Help @IntlCrimCourt prevent these crimes & build a #MoreJustWorld for present and future generations. https://t.co/Pue4TV5X7p #HumanityAgainstCrimes https://t.co/MKSVSSk3fu
"This is a complex, fast moving and far-reaching process. But, I remain absolutely determined to forge ahead."  –  @antonioguterres on UN Reform. https://t.co/ym7BwzBfzr https://t.co/b57gAAZdrD

After 66 years of pain and suffering, Alice received free fistula repair surgery. On Thursday's #EndFistula Day, see how @UNFPA works to help women like Alice: https://t.co/Ail2AtSRqK https://t.co/P2Pz5PHGSG
Conference in Norway on Thursday hosted by UN and partners aims to improve responses to & prevent sexual violence in humanitarian crises: https://t.co/HDbZZvxLne #EndSGBVOslo https://t.co/yZaZ6wXfij

No woman should suffer needlessly from a preventable condition like fistula -- one of the most serious & tragic childbirth injuries. More on Thursday's #EndFistula Day: https://t.co/WzNZYQHfiM https://t.co/BmnOrObzW5

The NEERE group is helping to weave a brighter future and #BeatPlasticPollution in Burkina Faso. Find out more from @UNEnvironment: https://t.co/UCKjtN8kcH  
https://t.co/8EF3dJHZtA

134 women recently completed the inaugural military & peacekeeping training programme in the United Arab Emirates. Thank you to all women & men #ServingForPeace worldwide. @UN_Women info: https://t.co/5m14OHzooT. https://t.co/miW1IL5Bl1

Businesses perform better with women in leadership roles. New @ILO report shows that gender diversity at the top boosts profits and makes it easier to attract talent: https://t.co/91Fjm938Fd #GlobalGoals https://t.co/TuOQ4DubsJ

Preserving the 🌎's biodiversity is vital for addressing climate change and achieving the #GlobalGoals & #ZeroHunger. More on Wednesday's #BiodiversityDay from @FAO here: https://t.co/vxRVeLBWg1 https://t.co/d0lfd3GcXg
UN Peacekeepers come from different countries, cultures and backgrounds -- but share a common purpose to protect the most vulnerable. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z  #ServingForPeace https://t.co/uFr5T18BlR

"The quality of the water we drink, the food we eat and the air we breathe all depend on keeping the natural world in good health." -- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's #BiodiversityDay. https://t.co/PrpqT4IYmk https://t.co/S6Y6oWBgO8
From universal health coverage to Ebola to antimicrobial resistance, see what's being discussed at @WHO's World Health Assembly. https://t.co/ISXTsgHLJn #WHA72 https://t.co/llJbc2Z7uM
As Muslims are observing the holy month of Ramadan, @UNRWA says that more than half the population in Gaza depends on the international community for food aid. https://t.co/DSOYss1mcR

Biodiversity is the foundation of the ecosystems we depend on for our food 🥕, fresh water 💧, medicines 💊, climate regulation ☀️ & more. Get details on Wednesday's #BiodiversityDay: https://t.co/ZnGjLWsR9F https://t.co/bRPkbftFF4

"African countries have a long record of keeping their borders, doors & hearts open to refugees & internally displaced people." -- @antonioguterres at opening of #AfricaDialogueSeries https://t.co/zKhKWMhyA3 #WithRefugees https://t.co/jTVqAYXSqL

Escalating trade tensions +
worsening financial conditions +
climate change
= risk of a prolonged global economic slowdown 

Growth projections have been revised down to 2.7% in 2019. Details from the midyear update of @UNDESA #WESP2019 report: https://t.co/PHLOxSxfEc https://t.co/SNJz6XB2UH

Cultural diversity gives life its colour, vibrancy, and flavour. Find out more about Tuesday's World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue & Development from @unesco: https://t.co/l8tdDXbRnr https://t.co/oOePF6DzlG
All hands on deck to solve the 🌏's most pressing challenges: NGO's can apply for @UNECOSOC consultative status from now through 1 June. https://t.co/D8ReqiMUXu #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Jl7rxp5Y3l
Starting Tuesday at UNHQ in NYC: #AfricaDialogueSeries with a special focus on displaced people. See what's expected: https://t.co/ymQkgM7Gtg https://t.co/YtMRDNciRu
Tuesday's World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue & Development celebrates humanity's rich diversity: https://t.co/ZTrj5wMFgb https://t.co/fd0VMNwX3s

#EndHumanTrafficking:  The 💙 represents the sadness of those who are trafficked while reminding us of the cold-heartedness of those who buy & sell human beings. @UNODC info: https://t.co/BXMeu6uxKU https://t.co/VIsxQ7bs9t
Tuesday's World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue & Development promotes intercultural dialogue as a way to achieve peace: https://t.co/v4LC9kgxRt https://t.co/uYEQpjnd1w
On Friday, a Malawian soldier who died protecting a fellow peacekeeper will become the first person to receive @UNpeacekeeping's highest honour for courage. https://t.co/4PLBLvnyXt #ServingForPeace

.@ECLAC_UN chief says proposed development plan for El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras & Mexico is the most comprehensive effort to date in support of the Global Compact #ForMigration https://t.co/AlE3od3MNE #GlobalGoals

📸: @UNStamps celebrates Monday's #WorldBeeDay with release of new set of stamps featuring these important pollinators which are key to biodiversity and food production. https://t.co/oeL8vvIDmr https://t.co/whFx6ZUdYh

Much of the food we eat depends on bees 🐝
These guardians of biodiversity play a 🗝️ role in achieving the #GlobalGoals. More info on Monday's #WorldBeeDay from @fao: https://t.co/mLVLCTj2wy https://t.co/yxdVofKxfF
Monday is #WorldBeeDay! Watch and learn more about our own resident bee colony at UNHQ in New York. ⬇️ https://t.co/WXcWe405oQ https://t.co/aCPrqWX13M
This week in NYC: Africa Dialogue Series focusing on "durable solutions for forcibly displaced persons." Follow @AfricaRenewal & see: https://t.co/Gj7FoIqUn1 #ADS2019 https://t.co/raKu1EfqSL
Starts this week in @UNGeneva: World Health Assembly. Follow @WHO, #WHA72 & see: https://t.co/wJdUBCJTR5 https://t.co/sSA7vO6sLL

Monday is #WorldBeeDay! 🐝
A world without pollinators would be a world without food diversity. Key facts from @undp: https://t.co/HEwabh1VWz https://t.co/4dhYFl85jg
This week in @UN_Vienna: latest meeting of the @UNODC Commission on Crime Prevention & Criminal Justice. Follow @CCPCJ, #CCPCJ28 & see: https://t.co/vEMTeHk3xk https://t.co/1nkoIk07iX
